revised_title: The Similarities between the Effects of Sympathetic Nerve Section and Spinal Cord Injury
tldr: This article discusses the similarities between the effects of sectioning the sympathetic nerve in the neck and a transverse section of a lateral half of the spinal cord. The author, E. Brown-Séquard, highlights various points of resemblance, such as increased sensitivity, muscle contractions, and blood vessel contractility. The author suggests that these similarities are due to a paralysis of vascular nerves and an increase in blood flow, leading to enhanced vital properties of nerves, muscles, and blood vessels.
